p: Lavender is one of the most popular plants in the world and originates from the mountain areas of the Mediterranean. The Lavandula genus belongs to the Lamiaceae family and includes over 30 species, out of which the most commonly cultivated are: L. angustifolia Mill. (narrow-leaved lavender), L. stoechas (French lavender) oraz L. latifolia (broad-leaved lavender). Its generic name comes from the verb lavare, which means “to wash” in Latin [ 1]. Out of all Lavandula genera, the most valuable genus in terms of unique biological activity is narrow-leaved lavender ( Lavandula angustifolia, formerly L. officinalis Chaix or L. vera), also known as garden lavender [ 2, 3].
